DOC.brief_summary: The broad objective research determine whether quick , simple intervention increase utilization contraceptive reminder adherence short‐term contraceptive regimen . Such intervention could implement easily additional resource busy clinical practice .
DOC.brief_title: Randomized Trial Provider‐Assisted Versus Patient‐Initiated Enrollment Bedsider.Org Online Contraceptive Reminder Tool
DOC.detailed_description: The specific aim study : 1 . Measure difference reminder utilization three month patient assist initiate reminder system office visit versus encourage self‐initiate visit . 2 . Assess whether provider‐assisted enrollment online reminder system improve adherence short‐term contraceptive regimen compare self‐ initiate enrollment visit .
DOC.criteria: 1 . Female , 1829 year old 2 . Prescribed one follow birth control : Oral contraceptive pill , vaginal ring , transdermal patch , Depo Provera 3 . Able provide consent 4 . Have regular access computer , Ipad , handheld device smartphone . 5 . Women must able read speak English ( Bedsider website translate Spanish ) 1 . Male 2 . Over age 30 year old 3 . NonEnglish Speaking 4 . Limited access computer , Ipad handheld device ( smartphone )
